bio: Giovanni Esposito is Chargé de cours (Lecturer) in Public Administration at ULB and Director of CEPAP, the Centre for the Study of Public Policy and Public Administration. He holds a PhD in Economics and Management from the Université de Liège (2018), with doctoral research on New Public Management models in EU governance of public infrastructure projects.

His research spans decision-making processes in the public sector, transport infrastructure, smart cities, and — most recently — Freedom of Information law implementation and citizen science approaches to policy evaluation. He has published in Evaluation, Public Management Review, International Review of Administrative Sciences, Government Information Quarterly, Cities, Policy & Society, and other leading journals.
